categories: Category:Legends short stories from Star Wars Insider

nodes.text: Eruption is a short story written by John Ostrander that appeared in Star Wars Insider 141. The story is a pre-Dawn of the Jedi: Into the Void story starring Hawk Ryo and Lanoree Brock. The audio version is included with the Dawn of the Jedi: Into the Void audiobook narrated by January LaVoy.

Je'daii Rangers Hawk Ryo and Lanoree Brock are sent by the Je'daii Council to negotiate a settlement between Dessain Mining and their workers. The workers want to have a representative who will voice their opinion on how the company is run. The two sides have decided that the best way to accomplish that is by an arranged marriage between Oma Dessain — daughter of the company's owner — and the oldest son of the workers' leader — Brom Santis. Unfortunately young Oma has been kidnapped by Dessain's rival Baron Volnos Ryo's people. The kidnapping has resulted in rising tension between the negotiating sides as both view the other as the culprit. In the meantime, the girl has been held in an abandoned building in Kainnan. The city has been evacuated due to an imminent volcano eruption. While Ranger Brock tries to keep the negotiations going, Ranger Ryo locates Oma. Using the eruption of the volcano as a diversion, he manages to rescue the girl. At the same time in the negotiation chambers Betolo — a servant of the Dessain family secretly working for the Shikaakwa crime lord — tries to poison Ranger Brock hoping that that will lead to an open conflict between both sides. However, Lanoree Brock senses that something is off with her drink and roots out the traitor from their midst. After Oma's return home, she refuses to marry the young Santis. While listening to the fight between father and daughter, Brock comes up with the idea of fostering — the youths will become foster children and spend six months with each household. The two families are forced to accept the Je'daii's suggestion, and after working out the details the Rangers leave Zerist. Lanoree Brock receives a message from the Council to return to Tython for a special mission, while Hawk Ryo heads out to Furies Gate.
